meanings.definition: A bell tower, especially one freestanding from a church or other building.
meanings.sent1: The campaniles of the old church rang out every evening, signaling the end of the day.
meanings.sent2: Tourists admired the beautiful campaniles that dotted the city skyline.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel climbed the campaniles, pretending to be the king of the tower.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the campaniles cast long shadows over the cobblestone streets.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the campaniles echoed through the valley, filling the air with music.
